item.description:
Authentication endpoints for login, register, and profile management.

**Role Hierarchy:**
1. `superadmin-master`: First superadmin, full control, can manage staff
2. `superadmin-staff`: Full system access, cannot create accounts
3. `admin`: Company admin
4. `manager`: Company manager
5. `staff`: Company staff

**Getting Started:**
1. Register first superadmin-master using master key
2. Login as superadmin-master
3. Create superadmin-staff accounts via Staff Management endpoints

item.name: Superadmin - Subscriptions

request.description:
**Buat subscription baru untuk company**

**üîÑ UPDATED - Payment Flow:**
Subscription dibuat dengan status **PENDING** (menunggu pembayaran).

**Flow:**
1. ‚úÖ Create Subscription ‚Üí Status: PENDING
2. üí≥ Create Payment ‚Üí Generate payment record
3. ‚úÖ Process Payment ‚Üí Subscription status ‚Üí ACTIVE

**Business Rules:**
- ‚ùó 1 company hanya bisa punya 1 active/trial subscription
- Subscription tidak langsung active, butuh payment dulu
- Akan throw ConflictException jika company sudah punya active subscription

**Billing Period:**
- `MONTHLY`: Monthly billing dengan harga monthlyPrice dari plan
- `YEARLY`: Yearly billing dengan harga yearlyPrice dari plan

**Price Calculation:**
- Sistem otomatis menghitung harga final berdasarkan:
  - Plan's monthlyPrice/yearlyPrice
  - Discount (monthlyDiscount/yearlyDiscount)
  - DiscountType (PERCENTAGE atau FIXED)

**Auto-calculated Fields:**
- `price`: Final price setelah discount
- `status`: PENDING (akan jadi ACTIVE setelah payment)
- `endDate`: Tanggal berakhir subscription
  - MONTHLY: startDate + 1 month (misal: 1 Jan ‚Üí 1 Feb, akses terakhir 1 Feb, putus 2 Feb)
  - YEARLY: startDate + 1 year (misal: 1 Jan 2025 ‚Üí 1 Jan 2026, akses terakhir 1 Jan 2026)
- `nextBillingAt`: Same as endDate (untuk renewal)

**Example:**
Plan: Rp 200.000/month, diskon 10%
- MONTHLY ‚Üí price: Rp 180.000, berlangganan 1 Jan ‚Üí expire 1 Feb
- YEARLY (Rp 2.160.000 - 10%) ‚Üí price: Rp 1.944.000, berlangganan 1 Jan ‚Üí expire 1 Jan tahun depan

**‚ö†Ô∏è Important:**
Akses terputus pada hari SETELAH endDate. Misal endDate 1 Feb, maka:
- ‚úÖ 1 Feb: Masih bisa akses
- ‚ùå 2 Feb: Sudah tidak bisa akses (expired)

**üìå Next Step:**
Setelah create subscription, lanjut ke **Superadmin - Payments** untuk create payment & process payment.

query.description: Filter by status: TRIAL, ACTIVE, EXPIRED, CANCELLED (optional)

request.description:
**List semua subscriptions dengan pagination**

**Query Parameters:**
- `page`: Page number (default: 1)
- `limit`: Items per page (default: 10)
- `status`: Filter by subscription status (optional)

**Status Values:**
- `TRIAL`: Trial period
- `ACTIVE`: Active subscription
- `EXPIRED`: Expired subscription
- `CANCELLED`: Cancelled subscription

**Response includes:**
- Subscription details
- Related plan details (name, monthly/yearly price)
- Related company details (name, email)
- Pagination metadata (total, page, limit, totalPages)

**Get detail subscription by ID**

**Response includes:**
- Complete subscription details
- Related pricing plan (name, features, prices)
- Related company (name, email, phone)
- Billing information (price, period, dates)
- Status and auto-renewal settings

**Get subscription berdasarkan Company ID**

**Use Case:**
- Melihat subscription status dari halaman detail company
- Check apakah company punya active subscription
- Get billing information untuk specific company

**Response includes:**
- Company details (id, name, email, phone, status)
- Subscription details (if exists)
- Related pricing plan information
- Billing period and price

**Response if no subscription:**
```json
{
  "company": {
    "id": "...",
    "name": "Company Name",
    "email": "company@email.com"
  },
  "subscription": null,
  "message": "Company does not have an active subscription"
}
```

**Response if has subscription:**
```json
{
  "company": {
    "id": "...",
    "name": "Company Name",
    "email": "company@email.com"
  },
  "subscription": {
    "id": "...",
    "planId": "...",
    "billingPeriod": "MONTHLY",
    "price": 180000,
    "status": "ACTIVE",
    "plan": {
      "name": "Starter",
      "monthlyPrice": 200000,
      "features": [...]
    }
  }
}
```

**Update subscription (partial update)**

**Updatable Fields:**
- `billingPeriod`: MONTHLY or YEARLY
- `autoRenew`: true or false
- `status`: TRIAL, ACTIVE, EXPIRED, CANCELLED
- `startDate`: Change start date
- `endDate`: Set end date (for manual expiry)

**Smart Recalculation:**
- Jika `billingPeriod` berubah:
  - Price otomatis dihitung ulang dari plan
  - nextBillingAt dihitung ulang (MONTHLY: +1 month, YEARLY: +1 year)

**Example:**
Change MONTHLY ‚Üí YEARLY:
- Old: Rp 180.000/month
- New: Rp 1.944.000/year (otomatis dihitung dari plan's yearlyPrice + discount)

**Cancel subscription**

**Actions performed:**
- Status ‚Üí CANCELLED
- autoRenew ‚Üí false
- endDate ‚Üí current timestamp

**Note:**
- Company masih bisa akses sampai endDate
- Tidak menghapus data subscription
- Bisa di-reactivate dengan update status

**Use Case:**
- User request cancellation
- Payment failure
- Violation of terms

**Hapus subscription permanently**

**‚ö†Ô∏è WARNING:**
- Permanent deletion
- Removes company.subscriptionId reference
- Cannot be undone

**Before deleting:**
- Consider cancelling instead of deleting
- Backup subscription data if needed

**Use Case:**
- Test data cleanup
- Incorrect subscription creation
- Company account deletion

**Example menggunakan data dari seeder**

**Cara menggunakan:**
1. Ambil planId dari GET /superadmin/pricing-plans
2. Ambil companyId dari GET /superadmin/companies
3. Set ke collection variables:
   - `{{planId}}`: ID dari pricing plan (misal: Starter)
   - `{{companyId}}`: ID dari company (misal: Demo Company)

**Test Case - Starter Plan (YEARLY):**
- Monthly Price: Rp 200.000
- Yearly Price: Rp 2.160.000
- Yearly Discount: 10%
- **Final Price: Rp 1.944.000/year**

**Expected Response:**
```json
{
  "id": "...",
  "planId": "...",
  "companyId": "...",
  "billingPeriod": "YEARLY",
  "price": 1944000,
  "startDate": "2025-01-01T00:00:00.000Z",
  "nextBillingAt": "2026-01-01T00:00:00.000Z",
  "status": "ACTIVE",
  "autoRenew": true
}
```

item.name: Superadmin - Payments

request.description:
**Create payment untuk subscription**

**Flow:**
1. User pilih plan ‚Üí Create subscription (status: PENDING)
2. Create payment ‚Üí Generate payment record (status: PENDING)
3. Payment expires dalam 24 jam

**Payment Methods:**
- Bank Transfer
- Credit Card
- E-Wallet (GoPay, OVO, Dana, dll)
- Virtual Account

**Payment Status:**
- PENDING: Menunggu pembayaran
- PROCESSING: Sedang diproses
- SUCCESS: Pembayaran berhasil
- FAILED: Pembayaran gagal
- EXPIRED: Pembayaran expired
- CANCELLED: Pembayaran dibatalkan

**Response:**
```json
{
  "id": "payment-uuid",
  "subscriptionId": "...",
  "amount": 180000,
  "status": "PENDING",
  "expiresAt": "2025-01-02T00:00:00.000Z",
  "subscription": {
    "id": "...",
    "status": "PENDING",
    "plan": {...},
    "company": {...}
  }
}
```

**Mock payment success (simulasi payment gateway)**

**‚ö†Ô∏è DEVELOPMENT ONLY:**
Endpoint ini untuk simulasi payment gateway sebelum integrasi dengan Midtrans/Xendit.

**What happens:**
1. Payment status ‚Üí SUCCESS
2. Set paidAt to current timestamp
3. Generate transactionId (atau gunakan dari body)
4. **Activate subscription** ‚Üí status PENDING ‚Üí ACTIVE
5. Update lastPaymentAt di subscription

**Production Flow (nanti):**
- Payment gateway (Midtrans/Xendit) kirim webhook
- Webhook handler verify signature
- Update payment & subscription status

**Response:**
```json
{
  "id": "payment-uuid",
  "status": "SUCCESS",
  "paidAt": "2025-01-01T10:00:00.000Z",
  "transactionId": "TRX-2025-001"
}
```

**Subscription auto-activated!** ‚úÖ

request.description:
Create a new employee with optional photo upload.

**Content-Type:** `multipart/form-data`

**Note:** Employee is created WITHOUT login access. Use "Grant Login Access" endpoint to give them login capability.

**Required fields:**
- `employeeCode` - Unique employee code (e.g., EMP001)
- `firstName` - Employee first name
- `lastName` - Employee last name
- `email` - Employee email (unique per company)

**Optional fields:**
- `phone` - Phone number
- `photo` - Photo file (JPG, PNG, GIF, WebP - Max 5MB). Upload as file, not path!
- `position` - Job position
- `department` - Department name
- `salary` - Monthly salary (as string: "15000000")
- `joinDate` - Join date (ISO DateTime format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.sssZ)
- `status` - ACTIVE | INACTIVE | ON_LEAVE | TERMINATED (default: ACTIVE)
- `regionId` - Region ID (e.g., "35.14.18.2007" for Wonosari village). Get from /regions endpoints
- `address` - Detail address (street, RT/RW, etc)
- `postalCode` - Postal code
- `roleId` - Role ID (use {{staff_role_id}} variable)

**Photo Upload & Processing:**
1. Select file in Postman (click "Select Files")
2. Choose image file (JPG, PNG, GIF, WebP)
3. Max file size: 5MB
4. **Auto Processing:**
   - Resized to max 800x800px (maintains aspect ratio)
   - Converted to WebP format (smaller size, better quality)
   - Compressed with 85% quality
   - EXIF data removed
5. Saved to `/uploads/employees/` with format: `employee-{timestamp}-{random}.webp`
6. Response includes photo path

**How to get regionId:**
1. GET /regions/list/provinces - Get province list
2. GET /regions/children/{provinceId} - Get cities/regencies
3. GET /regions/children/{cityId} - Get districts
4. GET /regions/children/{districtId} - Get villages
5. Use the village/district ID as regionId

**Response with Full Region Hierarchy:**
```json
{
  "id": "uuid",

  "lastName": "Doe",

  "regionId": "35.14.18.2007",

    "id": "35.14.18.2007",

    "level": "VILLAGE",
    "parentId": "35.14.18",

      "id": "35.14.18",

      "parentId": "35.14",

        "parent": {
          "id": "35",
```

Grant login access to an employee by creating a User account linked to the Employee.

**Request Body:**
```json
{
  "password": "Employee123!",
  "roleId": "uuid-of-role"
}
```

**Password Requirements:**
- Minimum 8 characters
- At least 1 uppercase letter
- At least 1 lowercase letter
- At least 1 number
- At least 1 special character (@$!%*?&)

**Validations:**
- Employee must exist and belong to your company
- Employee must NOT already have login access
- Email must not be used by another user
- Role must exist and NOT be superadmin role

**Response:**
```json
{
  "message": "Login access granted successfully",
  "employee": {
    "id": "uuid",
    "employeeCode": "EMP001",
    "name": "John Doe",
    "email": "john.doe@company.com",
    "hasAccess": true
  }
}
```

**What happens:**
1. Creates User account with hashed password
2. Links User to Employee (Employee.userId)
3. Employee can now login using their email and password
4. JWT token will include employeeId and employee data

**Common Errors:**
- `409 Conflict` - Employee already has login access
- `409 Conflict` - Email already used by another user
- `404 Not Found` - Role not found
- `400 Bad Request` - Cannot grant superadmin roles to employees

Revoke login access from an employee by deleting their User account.

**Validations:**
- Employee must exist and belong to your company
- Employee must HAVE login access

**Response:**
```json
{
  "message": "Login access revoked successfully",
  "employee": {
    "id": "uuid",
    "employeeCode": "EMP001",
    "name": "John Doe",
    "email": "john.doe@company.com",
    "hasAccess": false
  }
}
```

**What happens:**
1. Deletes User account
2. Employee.userId set to null automatically
3. Employee data remains intact (name, email, position, salary, etc)
4. Employee can no longer login
5. Any active tokens for this employee become invalid

**Use Cases:**
- Employee terminated - revoke access immediately
- Security breach - revoke access while investigating
- Role change - revoke then grant with new role
- Temporary suspension - revoke access, grant later

**Note:** This does NOT delete the employee record. To remove employee completely, use Delete Employee endpoint.

**Common Errors:**
- `404 Not Found` - Employee not found
- `400 Bad Request` - Employee does not have login access

Login as an employee who has been granted login access.

**Prerequisites:**
1. Employee must be created
2. Employee must have been granted login access (via Grant Login Access endpoint)

**Request Body:**
```json
{
  "email": "employee@company.com",
  "password": "Employee123!"
}
```

**Response includes employee data:**
```json
{
  "access_token": "eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9...",
  "user": {
    "id": "user-uuid",
    "firstName": "John",
    "lastName": "Doe",
    "email": "john.doe@company.com",
    "role": "staff",
    "company": "PT Example Company",
    "employeeCode": "EMP001",
    "position": "Marketing Manager",
    "department": "Marketing",
    "isSuperAdmin": false,
    "isSuperAdminMaster": false
  }
}
```

**JWT Payload includes:**
- `sub` - User ID
- `email` - User email
- `roleId` - Role ID
- `companyId` - Company ID
- `employeeId` - Employee ID (NEW!)
- `isSuperAdmin` - false
- `isSuperAdminMaster` - false

**Errors:**
- `401 Unauthorized` - Invalid credentials (wrong email/password)
- `401 Unauthorized` - Employee has no login access (User not created)
- `401 Unauthorized` - Account is inactive (User.isActive = false)

item.description:
**Employee Management with Login Access**

**Features:**
- Create, read, update, delete employees
- Grant/revoke login access to employees
- Employee statistics (by status, by department)
- Search and filter employees
- Pagination support
- Employee login with full authentication
- Employee address with Region integration

**Employee Status:**
- `ACTIVE` - Currently working
- `INACTIVE` - Temporarily inactive
- `ON_LEAVE` - On leave (cuti, sick leave, etc)
- `TERMINATED` - Employment terminated

**Address Fields:**
- `regionId` - Region ID (Province/City/District/Village)
- `address` - Detail address (street, RT/RW, etc)
- `postalCode` - Postal code

**How to use Address:**
1. User select region using `/regions` endpoints (autocomplete)
2. Save selected region ID to `regionId`
3. User input detail address (street, house number, RT/RW)
4. Response includes full region data (province, city, district, village)

**Login Access Flow:**
1. Create Employee (no login access)
2. Grant Access (creates User account linked to Employee)
3. Employee can login with email/password
4. (Optional) Revoke Access (deletes User, keeps Employee data)

**Architecture:**
- `Employee` = HR data master (gaji, posisi, department, alamat)
- `User` = Login credential (email, password, role)
- Relation: Employee ‚Üí User (optional, one-to-one)
- Relation: Employee ‚Üí Region (optional, for address)

**Use Cases:**
- Office staff (admin, marketing, sales) ‚Üí Grant access
- Security/cleaning service ‚Üí Don't grant access (data only)
- Terminated employee ‚Üí Revoke access (preserve HR data)

**Authentication:**
All endpoints require company admin/staff token.

**Authorization:**
Employees are scoped to the company of the authenticated user.

**See Also:**
- EMPLOYEE_LOGIN_GUIDE.md for complete documentation
- `/regions` endpoints for address autocomplete
